data.text: And Job answered and said,
So then ye alone are men,
But I also have a heart as well as you.
For a righteous and blameless man has become a subject for mockery.
For it had been ordained that he should fall under others at the appointed time,
Even as many as provoke the Lord,
But ask now the beasts, if they may speak to thee;
Tell the earth, if it may speak to thee:
Who then has not known in all these things,
Whereas the life of all living things is in his hand,
For the ear tries words,
In length of time is wisdom,
With him are wisdom and power,
If he should cast down, who will build up?
If he should withhold the water, he will dry the earth:
With him are strength and power:
He leads counselors away captive,
He seats kings upon thrones,
He sends away priests into captivity,
He changes the lips of the trustworthy,
He pours dishonor upon princes,
Revealing deep things out of darkness:
Causing the nations to wander, and destroying them:
Perplexing the minds of the princes of the earth:
Let them grope in darkness, and let there be no light,
